title: Decemberists Concert Poster typeface
content:
Hi, I was wondering what typeface "Decemberists" is is. Here is the poster: [http://www.thedecoderring.com/images/items/PF\_DEC1\_1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141025091715/http:/www.thedecoderring.com/images/items/PF_DEC1_1.jpg "http://www.thedecoderring.com/images/items/PF\_DEC1\_1.jpg")  
Thanks everyone
author: phaedrus

comments.content: No answer here. Just letting you know that you're not the only one on the edge of your seat about this ID. This is a beautiful poster. Thanks for sharing it here!

Thanks for the reply, it is such a nice poster. In the interest of full disclosure, my response was not really neccesary and I am kind of shamelessly bumping this. If that sort of thing is not appreciated let me know and i won't do it again, but I am really curious what it is
I'll ask the band and get back to you.

Evan said: <cite>shamelessly bumping this. If that sort of thing is not appreciated let me know</cite>

[The FAQ says](http://web.archive.org/web/20141025091715/http:/typophile.com/forum/typeid/faq/#Q_9):  
<cite>The best way to “revive” your thread is to post a little reminder in your original thread. Please don’t create a duplicate thread with the same request as this annoys the hell out of me.</cite>

So, you absolutely did the right thing! ;-)
I too am eagerly awaiting an ID on this beauty!

That appears to be [QBF's](http://web.archive.org/web/20141025091715/http:/www.qbf.de/dceng.htm) [Mohair](http://web.archive.org/web/20141025091715/http:/www.qbf.de/cart/cart.exe?gif=dc.gif/Sdc02599.gif). The preview image is lousy, but I have the font and can assure you that it is a match.

Edit: Might still be available from [Castcraft](http://web.archive.org/web/20141025091715/http:/www.castcraft-software.com/homepage.html) as Emporium Ten and that may or may not be the original name.

How about the subtext? "Long Winters... The Places..." At first I thought it was the same face without the outline and ornamentation, but I was wrong. Anyone?

Thanks in advance!

fyi, saw this featured in Stephen Heller's New Vintage Type ... it was done by Christian Helms using Opti Emporium, as Mike noted.

[http://www.thedecoderring.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141025091715/http:/www.thedecoderring.com/ "http://www.thedecoderring.com/")
Nice catch, Brian. Thanks for the confirmation.
